alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Suffolk (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 11 at 3:28PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of , the western City of Chesapeake, the City of Portsmouth and the eastern City of Suffolk through 415 PM EST... At 327 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Corapeake, or 9 miles northeast of Sunbury, moving north at 30 mph. This storm has shown some broad rotation at times and may intensify. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Churchland, Deep Creek, Downtown Portsmouth, Norfolk, Chesapeake, Portsmouth, Suffolk, Driver, Cradock, Bowers Hill, Western Branch, Huntersville, Magnolia, Wilroy and Deanes. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EST for northeastern North Carolina...and southeastern Virginia.
